intro: Justicia ciliata, commonly known as the velvetleaf or silverleaf plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a soft, velvety appearance. The plant produces clusters of tubular, showy flowers in shades of red, orange, or yellow, which bloom throughout the growing season. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil. Justicia ciliata is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive foliage and vibrant floral display.
